instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck at 5v
threads.message: Hi this is a strange one i have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck at 5v (Not strange yet) changed changed <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> tested had 19v booting up , fitted in laptop back to 5v , took out and reflowed u700 incase it didnt sit properly, back to 19v , fitted in laptop back to 5v ,took out and changed u700 back to 19v , then i stopped for a cuppa and when i went back to it its back to 5v . Anyhow it turns out if i warm that part of the board it goes to 19v and then when it gets cold it gets stuck at 5v. Before i pull my hair out has this happened to anyone else ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck at 5v
threads.message:
Any history available?
There could be accumulated crap under SMC, or <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chip.
All 4 ports have the same behaviour, in both charger directions?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck at 5v
threads.message: just came in as dead , no signs of spillage at all, but had been to another repair shop but couldnt really see any signs of the board being worked on , i did change all 4 <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips but 1 has steady 5v the other 3 cycle , same both directions

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck at 5v
threads.message:
The problem should be located on the fixed 5V port.
The other cycle because the board tries to start.
Compare diode mode readings on LDO outputs between <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips.
